author: Ronjel Delfin

text: Sec Pi침ol, gov... ganito... please consider 80% financing from our local central bank vs 20% israeli. Why? Loan principal is payable in 10 years. If we owe say 80% to a foreign bank, if we default, their legal provisions in loan contract is triggered to the detriment to our interests. To maintain our financial independence, the financial sources must be local so in the event we have a default, it is the same government that will trigger its legal clauses and NOT a foreign entity. Safer, smarter end game.  Congrats for this milestone!!
author: Gerard Dacudao

text: Mr. Pi침ol, naghihintay ako ng post na katulad nito. Isa rin po akong magsasaka. Since NFA is now closed their rice milling facility will now be mothballed. I think the rice farmers can make full use of it by pooling themselves as one big cooperative and operate the same. Farmers can now sell rice instead of palay. The social media can play a role in selling their rice to the public. If successful, the government can build good rice mills in rice producing regions and hand it over to an established group of legitimate farmers. We had bad experiences with equipments given by the DA. Tools given were not properly researched and examined that most of it became useless. Worst, the system of procurement through lowest bidder resulted in inferior quality of equipment given to us. Hope this be given consideration.
author: Mati Pagtakhan
